gr.aueb.databasics

Class CommandLineMenu

  • java.lang.Object
    • gr.aueb.databasics.CommandLineMenu

  • public class CommandLineMenu
extends Object
    A class that has all the menus that show while the program is running. It holds an activeTable as well as an activeDatabase based on the user's choices, in order to perform the functions needed.

    The menu has different levels, from the app startup, where the user has control over all the databases they hold in their system to a micro-level where they have control over the details of a single table.

    This class has all menus covering each and every one functionality of the app. It performs all i/o transactions with the user. It checks for restricted access on specific attributes, where functions are disallowed to be performed manually by the user etc.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Artemis Doumeni, Evi Vratsanou, George Bakalis, Andreas Vlachos, Kostas Kyriakidis, Martha Pontika

      • programTermination

        public static void programTermination()
        This method's purpose is to terminate the program if no unsaved data exist or ask the user (yes/no) whether he wants to terminate the program if unsaved data exist in one of the loaded databases.

      • checkUnsaved

        public static boolean checkUnsaved()
        This method checks if unsaved data exist in any of the databases, prints a message for each database that contains unsaved data and returns a boolean to indicate whether unsaved data exist in DatabaseUniverse
        Returns:
        a boolean variable that is returned as true if unsaved data exist within at least one database, and false if not.

      • checkAnswer

        public static String checkAnswer()
        Check if an answer is acceptable
        Returns:
        Returns the accepted answer or recursively repeats until an acceptable answer is given.

      • cancel

        public static boolean cancel(String str)
        Cancels action and returns to the previous menu at any time the word "cancel" is given as input by the user
        Parameters:
        str - The user's input
        Returns:
        Returns true if the user has typed "cancel" or false if the input is anything else

      • cancelProcedure

        public static boolean cancelProcedure(String str)
        Cancels a whole procedure (e.g. Database creation) and returns to the previous menu if the word "cancel" or "yes" is given as input by the user, when asked if they want to completely cancel procedure in menu
        Parameters:
        str - The user's input
        Returns:
        Returns true if the user has typed "cancel" or false if the input is anything else

      • areYouSure

        public static boolean areYouSure()
        Checks if the user is certain about an action that makes an important change (e.g. table deletion)
        Returns:
        Returns true if the user has typed "yes" or false if the input is "no"

      • databaseCreationMenu

        public static void databaseCreationMenu()
        Create the first table. Give the user the option to add more tables to the database in its creation process. Give access to database menu.

      • addTable

        public static void addTable()
        Add table in database. Offer options to create a brand new table or copy an existing one. Check if the input choice is valid.

      • readTable

        public static String readTable()
        Read a table name and check if it corresponds to a table. If not try again.
        Returns:
        Returns the name of the table or null if the user chooses to cancel

      • readDatabase

        public static String readDatabase()
        Read the name of a database the user types. Check if the database exists and if yes ask for another name. Return the name the user types.
        Returns:
        Returns the name of the database or null if the user chooses to cancel

      • tableMenu

        public static void tableMenu()
        Present options to edit a specific table (search, sort, view, add attribute and entry, change data, delete data).

      • searchMenu

        public static void searchMenu()
        This method enables the user to make use of the search function. The user can insert a set of attribute names(up to the attributes existing in the table) and a value for each one of them. Then the method Table.search(ArrayList, ArrayList) is called, returning the positions of the matching lines, which will feed the Table.viewLines(ArrayList) method, presenting the set of lines that match the search criteria.

        public static void menuViewAttribute(String tableName)

        Returns:

      • readOrder

        public static int readOrder()
        Read the order for sort function (ascending or descending).
        Returns:
        Returns +1 for ascending or -1 for descending

      • menuDataChange

        public static void menuDataChange()
        Menu for data change function. Asks for the line number that will change and continues to do so for all the lines the user chooses.

      • readAttributes

        public static ArrayList<String> readAttributes()
        Read an ArrayList of Attributes that are used in change data function.
        Returns:
        Returns an ArrayList of Attributes or an empty ArrayList if the user cancels

      • readValues

        public static ArrayList<String> readValues(int num,
                                           ArrayList<String> atts)
        Read all the values that will change in data change function.
        Parameters:
        num - The line affected by the data change
        atts - The attributes affected by the data change
        Returns:
        Returns the values used to change the fields or an empty ArrayList if the user cancels

      • deleteMenu

        public static void deleteMenu()
        Menu for delete function. Offer options to delete an entry (1), an attribute(2) or an element (3)

      • printDeleteChoices

        public static void printDeleteChoices()
        Print choices for delete function (1: entry, 2: attribute, 3: element)
